thread.title: Reports: MRI On Hamilton’s Knee Comes Back Clean
thread.title_full: Reports: MRI On Hamilton’s Knee Comes Back Clean

author: joshclark16
title: Reports: MRI On Hamilton’s Knee Comes Back Clean
text:
Reports: MRI On Hamilton’s Knee Comes Back Clean February 23, 2017 9:31 AM Josh Hamilton #32 of the Texas Rangers returns to the dugout after being caught trying to stretch a double during the seventh inning against the Cleveland Indians at Progressive Field on May 27, 2015 in Cleveland, Ohio. (Photo by Jason Miller/Getty Images) 
SURPRISE (105.3 The Fan) – The MRI on Josh Hamilton’s surgically repaired left knee came back clean, according to multiple reports. Hamilton received PRP injection in left knee, hopes to resume BB activities at start of week, not dismayed by knee issue 
— Evan Grant (@Evan_P_Grant) February 23, 2017 
Evan Grant of the Fort Worth Star-Telegram reports that Hamilton hopes to resume baseball activities at the start of next week.
